title: UC Davis variety recommendations
author: Paul M. Vossen and Deborah Silva
description: the same tables are reproduced as individual PDFs and also in the California Master Gardener Handbook (2015)

categories.name: early summer
categories.description: These cultivars do not have the high-quality characteristics of standard cultivars but ripen early when no other fresh apples are available. They are good for eating fresh and cooking.

categories.name: disease resistant
categories.description: Several scab-resistant apple cultivars have been developed in breeding programs for the eastern United States, where this disease is quite sever due to summer humidity and rain. Some have received limited testing under California growing conditions. In growing districts with extended spring rains, organic growers should experiment with these cultivars to see how they perform in their orchards.

plants.name: Fuji
plants.description: Round to flat apple with very sweet yellow-orange flesh. Skin is red if given enough sunlight and cool temperatures. One of the best sweet eating apples. Stores well.

plants.name: Gala
plants.description: Small to medium sized, conic red apple with excellent flavor and keeping qualities. The best cultivar for the early season.

plants.name: Gravenstein
plants.description: Medium-large fruit with short, fat stem. Skin is greenish yellow overlaid with red stripes. Excellent flavor when fully ripe. Crisp, subacid, and aromatic. A good sauce and pie apple. Stores and ships poorly. High percentage of windfalls. Sterile pollen.

plants.name: Golden Delicous
plants.description: Conic apple with a long stem, yellow to green skin, yellow flesh, and russet dots. Sweet, juicy, fine textured. Number one on the California North Coast for fresh eating quality and processing. Stores well but susceptible to bitter pit, bruising, russeting. Erratic in self-fruitfulness.

plants.name: Granny Smith
plants.description: Round, green to yellow-skinned apple that is quite firm. Keeps very well. Crisp flesh. If harvested early, it is green and tart. Late-harvested fruit are yellow and sweet.

plants.name: Jonathan
plants.description: Round, red apple with pure white flesh. Crisp, juicy, and slightly subacid. Excellent for eating fresh, sauce, and juice. Highly susceptible to mildew, fire blight, and Jonathan spot.

plants.name: Red Delicious
plants.description: Conic apple with tapered base and five distinct lobes. Skin color varies from solid red to a mixture of red and green stripes. Crisp, sweet, mid-flavored yellow flesh. Many strains. Best used fresh. Stores well

plants.name: Rome Beauty
plants.description: Round fruit with a deep cavity, no lobes, and little russet. Several strains, including the old standard and several new strains with solid red skin, such as Taylor and Law. Stores moderately well. Tree leafs out late, flowers late, and produces flowers and fruit on long spur growth that requires modification in pruning. Good for baking.

plants.category_description: Strains (mutations) of the original cultivars that have shorter internodes and are naturally dwarfing. Best on seedling rootstock.
These cultivars are adapted to the low latitudes of southern California because they have low winter chilling requirements (< 300 hours).

These cultivars do well in much of California if there is adequate chilling and summer heat is not too intense. They are hard to find because they lack commercial value. Many have excellent flavor and perform well in home gardens.

plants.name: Akane
plants.description: Similar to Jonathan but earlier, good solid red color, white flesh, good for eating fresh and juice.

plants.name: Jerseymac
plants.description: Large, good red color, excellent flavor, firmer than McIntosh, stores 4 to 8 weeks.

plants.name: Jonamac
plants.description: Similar to McIntosh but has better color, firmness, and storage life.

plants.name: Paulared
plants.description: High-quality, white flesh, stores fairly well, tree requires thinning.

plants.name: Vista Bell
plants.description: Terminal bearing habit, white-fleshed fruit, stores well.

plants.name: Enterprise
plants.description: A large-fruited, late-maturing, dense, crisp cultivar that has good keeping qualities. The skin is dark red over a yellow-green background. One of the best of the scab-resistant cultivars.

plants.name: Florina
plants.description: A promising scab-resistant selection from France, with large, round oblong, purple-red fruit; ripens late and has a mixed sweet tart flavor.

plants.name: Freedom
plants.description: A late-season cultivar with large fruit and mild flavor; not completely immune to scab.

plants.name: Goldrush
plants.description: A scab-immune selection with Golden Delicious parentage; late maturing, large, firm textured, and tart with an excellent flavor; stores well.

plants.name: Jonafree
plants.description: A midseason apple that compares with Jonathan, with soft flesh and uneven coloring.

plants.name: Liberty
plants.description: One of the best-quality apples of the disease-resistant cultivars; is very productive and requires heavy early thinning to achieve good size; ripens in midseason, has an attractive red color with some striping, and a good, sweet flavor.

plants.name: Prima
plants.description: An early-season, uneven-ripening, moderate-quality cultivar.

plants.name: Priscilla
plants.description: A late-season cultivar with small fruit, soft flesh, and mild flavor.

plants.name: Pristine
plants.description: Moderate to large, tart, yellow apple immune to scab and resistant to fire blight and mildew.

plants.name: Red Free
plants.description: Matures in early July, heat-sensitive, small fruited; susceptible to water core, sunburn, and russet.

plants.name: Williams Pride
plants.description: Early maturing, scab immune; also resistant to fire blight and mildew; medium to large fruit with a round-oblique shape; attractive red striped color on a green-yellow background.

plants.name: Bartlett
plants.description: The best-quality pear fruit. Bell shaped with white flesh and excellent flavor. Tree is susceptible to fire blight. Fruit keep relatively well, up to 2 months after maturing in August. Sensation is a red Bartlett.

plants.name: Bosc
plants.description: Midseason cultivar that bears heavy crops regularly. Fruit are long and tapering, with a long neck and stem. Skin is golden russet brown.

plants.name: Comice
plants.description: Inconsistent bearer. Excellent fruit, green with red blush. Delicate skin, chubby shape. Very vigorous tree, does best on Quince rootstock. Late maturing.

plants.name: Dâ€™Anjou
plants.description: Good winter pear with excellent keeping qualities. A large, vigorous tree. Egg-shaped fruit with a small shoulder. Light green to yellow-green color with white flesh. French origin. There is a red strain called Red Anjou.

plants.name: Seckel
plants.description: The small fruit are reddish green, with very dense, sweet, flavorful flesh. Excellent quality for the home orchard. Resistant to fire blight and pear scab.

plants.name: Winter Nellis
plants.description: Medium small, almost round fruit with light russeting over a green skin. Resistant to blight. Large tree. Regular producer, but late.

plants.category_description: These pear cultivars are adapted to the low latitudes of southern California becuse they have low winter chilling requirements (< 300 hours).

plants.name: Chojuro
plants.description: Greenish brown to brown russet skin. Coarse, tasty flesh.

plants.name: Hosui
plants.description: Brown skin, juicy white flesh with a sweet aromatic flavor.

plants.name: Kikusui
plants.description: Yellow-green skin. White flesh, excellent flavor. Fruit drop from tree when ripe.

plants.name: Niiataka
plants.description: Very large, juicy fruit with an aromatic flavor.

plants.name: Nijisseiki
plants.description: Also known as Twentieth Century. Excellent quality. Very popular cultivar, yellow-green skin.

plants.name: Shinko
plants.description: Brown russet skin; firm, crisp flesh; very aromatic flavor.

plants.name: Shinseiki
plants.description: Amber yellow skin; White flesh is crisp but softens rapidly; less flavor than other cultivars.

plants.name: Tsu Li
plants.description: Blooms early. Use Ya Li as pollenizer. Chinese type (pear shape). Light green color, crisp, tasty flesh.

plants.name: Ya Li
plants.description: Blooms early. Use Tsu Li as pollenizer. Chinese type (pear shape). Light, shiny yellow color, crisp, tasty flesh.

plants.name: Ambrosia
plants.description: Huge fruit, pale pink skin; similar to Wonderful

plants.name: Eversweet
plants.description: Very sweet, almost seedless fruit. Red skin, clear juice. Good for coastal areas.

plants.name: Granada
plants.description: Deep crimson fruit color. Matures early but needs heat

plants.name: Ruby Red
plants.description: Matures late (with Wondeful) but not as sweet or colorful as Wonderful. All fruit matures at once.

plants.name: Wonderful
plants.description: Large, deep red fruit. Large, juicy, red kernels. Small seed. Matures late. Juice is made into grenadine syrup.

plants.name: Champion
plants.description: Green-yellow flesh. Pear-shaped fruit.

plants.name: Orange
plants.description: Orange-yellow flesh. Golden skin. Rich flavor. Low-chill cultivar.

plants.name: Pineapple
plants.description: The preferred cultivar. Pineapple flavor. White flesh. Golden skin. Low-chill fruit.

plants.name: Smyrna
plants.description: Large fruit with brown pubescence. Light, tender flesh. Yellow skin. Low-chill fruit.

plants.name: Van Deman
plants.description: Pale yellow, coarse flesh. Orange skin turns red when cooked.

plants.name: Autumn Royal
plants.description: Blenheim sport (mutation). Ripens in late summer to fall.

plants.name: Moorpark
plants.description: Excellent flavor, ripens unevenly, highly colored.

plants.name: Royal
plants.description: Large, very flavorful, used for eating fresh and drying.

plants.name: Tilton
plants.description: Large fruit, heavy producer. Mild flavor. Used for canning.

plants.category_description: These apricot cultivars are adapted to the low latitudes of southern California because they have low winter chilling requirements (< 300 hours).
These cultivars are newer and should be evaluated for your climate zone and site before being selected.

plants.name: Bing
plants.description: Industry standard. Deep mahogany red fruit. Produces very heavily. Very susceptible to bacterial canker. Pollenized by Van, Black tartarian, or Sam. Bing, Lambert, and Royal Ann will not pollinate each other (they are intrasterile).

plants.name: Black Tartarian
plants.description: Small, black fruit. A good pollenizer for Bing and most other cultivars.

plants.name: Brooks
plants.description: A large, dark red fruit with good flavor. Produces few doubles even in hot climates.

plants.name: Early Burlat
plants.description: Moderate-sized fruit. Ripens 2 weeks before Bing. Soft flesh. Pollenized by Bing and B. Tartarian.

plants.name: Early Ruby
plants.description: Early season. Large, dark fred fruit. Prolific. Fruit hold on tree.

plants.name: Lambert
plants.description: Dark, large, firm fruit. Pollenized by Van. Late season. Lambert, Bing, and Royal Ann do not pollinate each other.

plants.name: Rainier
plants.description: Yellow-red blush. Large, crack-resistant fruit.

plants.name: Royal Ann
plants.description: Yellow fruit with a red blush. Pollenized by Van. Late season, Royal Ann, Lambert, and Bing will not pollinate each other.

plants.name: Stella
plants.description: Dark-fleshed fruit. Matures just after Bing. Self-fruitful.

plants.name: Van
plants.description: Large, dark fruit. Pollenized by Bing or Lambert.

plants.name: Early Richmond
plants.description: Very early in season. Bright red fruit.

plants.name: Meteor
plants.description: Semidwarf.

plants.name: Montmorency
plants.description: The leadign sour cultivar. Medium-sized, dark red fruit.

plants.name: North Star
plants.description: Semidwarf. Self-fruitful.

plants.name: Arctic Glo
plants.description: Small, fantastic flavor. White flesh. Early.

plants.name: Fantasia
plants.description: Large, brightly-colored yellow freestone. Late.

plants.name: Flamekist
plants.description: Excellent quality. Large, firm, yellow, clingstone.

plants.name: Flavortop
plants.description: Large, excellent flavor. Yellow, freestone. Midseason.

plants.name: Goldmine
plants.description: Large, great flavor. White flesh. Freestone.

plants.name: Heavenly White
plants.description: Large, excellent flavor. White flesh.

plants.name: May Grand
plants.description: Large, yellow fruited, freestone. Early.

plants.name: Panamint
plants.description: Medium-sized fruit. Red skin, golden flesh. Freestone, low-chill cultivar.

plants.name: Red Gold
plants.description: Large, excellent flavor. Stores well. Late.

plants.name: Rose
plants.description: Old favorite white freestone with excellent flavor and low-chilling requirement.

plants.name: September Red
plants.description: Large, yellow. Very late.

plants.name: Snow Queen
plants.description: Early-season white freestone, juicy and tasty.

plants.name: Summer Grand
plants.description: One of the best. Large, yellow, freestone.

plants.category_description: These nectarine cultivars are adapted to the low latitudes of southern California because they have low winter chilling requirements.

plants.name: Autumn Gold
plants.description: Medium-large fruit. Yellow flesh. Keeps well.

plants.name: Babcock
plants.description: Medium sized. White flesh. Freestone, low-chill cultivar.

plants.name: Earligrande
plants.description: Excellent flavor. Yellow-red blush. Semifreestone, low-chill cultivar.

plants.name: Fairtime
plants.description: Large fruit. Yellow, firm flesh. Excellent flavor.

plants.name: Fay Elberta
plants.description: Large fruit. Yellow flesh. Freestone.

plants.name: Forty-Niner
plants.description: Large fruit. Yellow flesh. Freestone.

plants.name: Indian Blood
plants.description: Cling. Red skin and flesh. Tart. Prolific.

plants.name: La Feliciana
plants.description: Medium sized. Firm, red. Excellent flavor. Somewhat more disease resistant.

plants.name: Loring
plants.description: Very large fruit. Red skin. Yellow flesh. Freestone. Somewhat more disease resistant.

plants.name: Nectar
plants.description: White flesh. Pink skin. Excellent flavor.

plants.name: Oâ€™Henry
plants.description: One of the best. Large fruit. Yellow flesh. Freestone.

plants.name: Redhaven
plants.description: Yellow. Semifreestone. Needs heavy thinning.

plants.name: Rio Oso Gem
plants.description: Very large fruit. Yellow flesh. Freestone.

plants.name: Springcrest
plants.description: Medium sized. Yellow flesh. Semi-freestone.

plants.name: Suncrest
plants.description: Large fruit. Yellow flesh. Freestone. Midseason.

plants.name: Veteran
plants.description: Red blush. Elberta-type. Freestone. Dependable, heavy producer, excellent flavor. Somewhat more disease resistant.

plants.category_description: These peach cultivars are adapted to the low latitudes of southern California because they have low winter chilling requirements (< 300 hours).

plants.name: Autumn Rosa
plants.description: Large. Purple skin. Self-fertile. Japanese plum.

plants.name: Beauty
plants.description: Green skin, amber flesh, heart shaped. Poor keeper. Japanese plum.

plants.name: Burgundy
plants.description: Red skin and flesh. Self-fertile. Holds well.

plants.name: El Dorado
plants.description: Purple skin. Amber flesh. Large, oblong.

plants.name: Elephant Heart
plants.description: Purple skin. Large, heart shaped. Japanese plum.

plants.name: Friar
plants.description: Black skin. Firm, amber flesh. Mild flavor. Japanese plum.

plants.name: Golden Nectar
plants.description: Large. Yellow flesh. Tender skin. Great flavor. Japanese plum.

plants.name: Howard Wonder
plants.description: Large, pink skin. Yellow flesh. Japanese plum.

plants.name: Kelsey
plants.description: Green-yellow skin and flesh. Japanese plum.

plants.name: Laroda
plants.description: Red-purple skin. Yellow flesh.

plants.name: Mariposa
plants.description: Green-yellow skin. Red flesh. Large, heart shaped. Japanese plum.

plants.name: Nubiana
plants.description: Purple-black skin. Yellow flesh. Oblong. Japanese plum.

plants.name: President
plants.description: Large. Blue skin. Yellow flesh. European plum.

plants.name: Red Beauty
plants.description: Red skin, yellow flesh, excellent flavor.

plants.name: Roysum
plants.description: Light purple skin. Yellow flesh.

plants.name: Santa Rosa
plants.description: Purple skin. Amber flesh. Excellent flavor. Japanese plum.

plants.name: Satsuma
plants.description: Red skin and flesh. Small, round. Japanese plum.

plants.name: Shiro
plants.description: Light greenâ€“yellow skin. Yellow flesh.

plants.name: Simka
plants.description: Dark black skin. Yellow flesh. Oblong.

plants.name: Sprite Cherry Plum
plants.description: Black, sweet skin. Exotic flavor. Small.

plants.name: Wickson
plants.description: Green-yellow skin. Yellow flesh. Large, heart shaped. Japanese plum.

plants.category_description: These plum cultivars are adapted to the low latitudes of southern California because they have low winter chilling requirements.

plants.name: French
plants.description: Medium-sized fruit. Self-fertile. Late maturing. European plum.

plants.name: Green Gage
plants.description: Greenish yellow skin. Amber flesh. Old, European plum.

plants.name: Imperial
plants.description: Large fruit. Requires cross pollination. Late maturing. European plum.

plants.name: Italian
plants.description: Large fruit. Purple skin. Yellow flesh. European plum.

plants.name: Flavor Supreme
plants.description: Pluot. Green to brown skin. Red, juicy flesh. Excellent size and flavor.

plants.name: Flavor King
plants.description: low chill. Pluot. Red-purple skin. Good size, irregular ripening, sweet flavor. Cross-pollinated with Flavor Grenade, Beauty Plum, or Burgundy Plum.

plants.name: Flavor Queen
plants.description: Pluot. Green-golden skin. Yellow, firm flesh. Good size. Excellent, very sweet flavor.

plants.name: Flavor Grenade
plants.description: low chill. Pluot. Green skin with red blush. Elongated shape, excellent flavor. Best pollinated with Burgundy plum.

plants.name: Flavorella
plants.description: Plumcot. Golden yellow skin. Very sweet, excellent flavor.

plants.name: Flavor Ann
plants.description: Aprium. Golden skin and flesh. Strong, sweet apricot flavor.

plants.name: Flavor Delight
plants.description: low chill. Aprium. Golden skin and flesh. Strong, sweet apricot flavor. Reliable production. Sets best with cross-pollination from an apricot.

plants.name: Carmel
plants.description: Excellent quality. Nut well sealed in the shell. Excellent pollinzer.

plants.name: Mission
plants.description: Late-blooming; productive tree. Hard shell, short kernel.

plants.name: Neplus Ultra
plants.description: Large, soft-shelled nut. Long, flat kernel. Good pollenizer.

plants.name: Nonpareil
plants.description: The most popular paper-shelled cultivar. Interfruitful with Price, Mission, Carmel.

plants.name: Price
plants.description: Very similar to Nonpareil. A good pollenizer.

plants.name: Colossal
plants.description: The industry standard and the overall best choice. Large fruited. Excellent quality. Parentage unknown.

plants.name: Dunstan
plants.description: A cross of American and Chinese cultivars. Medium-small nuts. Sweet, and blight resistant. Late flowering.

plants.name: Eurobella
plants.description: Large nut. Good pollenizer for Colossal.

plants.name: Seedling
plants.description: Not a named cultivar. Each tree is genetically different. Unknown fruit quality. Unknown tree shape and fruit size. Only known rootstock.

plants.name: Silverleaf
plants.description: Medium-sized nut. Good pollenizer for colossal, but shell splits are a problem.

plants.category_description: These cultivars are available for trial.

plants.name: Barcelona
plants.description: The old industry standard. Use Davianna or Du Chilly as a pollenizer.

plants.name: Brixnut
plants.description: A secondary main production nut. Use Davianna or Du Chilly as a pollenizer.

plants.name: Butler
plants.description: Pollenizer for Ennis.

plants.name: Davianna
plants.description: Use Barcelona or Du Chilly as a pollenizer.

plants.name: Du Chilly
plants.description: Use Barcelona or Davianna as a pollenizer.

plants.name: Ennis
plants.description: A new cultivar that has better quality than Barcelona. Use Butler as a pollenizer.

plants.name: White Aveline
plants.description: General pollenizer.

plants.name: Apache
plants.description: Late pollen shed. Early receptivity.

plants.name: Barton
plants.description: Early pollen shed and receptivity.

plants.name: Bradley
plants.description: Excellent pollenizer for Western Schley.

plants.name: Choctaw
plants.description: Late pollen shed. Early receptivity.

plants.name: Comanche
plants.description: Late pollen shed. Early receptivity.

plants.name: Shawnee
plants.description: Early pollen shed. Midseason receptivity.

plants.name: Sioux
plants.description: Early pollen shed and receptivity.

plants.name: Western Schley
plants.description: Early pollen shed and receptivity.

plants.name: Wichita
plants.description: Late pollen shed. Early receptivity.

plants.name: Joley
plants.description: Female. Smaller nuts. Fewer blanks. More splits. Pistachio may not produce well in most areas of southern California.

plants.name: Kerman
plants.description: Female. Best nut-producing cultivar. Pistachio may not produce well in most areas of southern California.

plants.name: Peters
plants.description: Male. Good for pollination. Pistachio may not produce well in most areas of southern California.

plants.name: Sfax
plants.description: Smaller, good-quality nuts. Pistachio may not produce well in most areas of southern California.

plants.name: Chandler
plants.description: Best choice for coastal California. New cultivar. 80% fruitful lateral buds. Produces a smaller tree that requires careful pruning and training. Blooms late. Leafs out late.

plants.name: Hartley
plants.description: The main cultivar grown in California. Excellent-quality nuts. Huge tree but requires little pruning. 5% fruitful lateral buds. Leafs out late, blooms late. Good choice.

plants.name: Howard
plants.description: Good choice. New cultivar. 80% fruitful lateral buds. Produces a smaller tree that requires careful pruning and training. Blooms late. Leafs out late.

plants.name: Mayette
plants.description: Old-time cultivar. PLant as a pollenizer for late-blooming cultivars. Poor producer. Leafs out late. Blooms late. Large tree.

plants.name: S. Franquette
plants.description: Old-time cultivar. Should be planted as a pollenizer for the late-blooming cultivars. Poor producer. Leafs out late. Blooms late. Large tree, but requires little pruning.

plants.name: Tehama
plants.description: Good choice. New cultivar. 80% fruitful lateral buds. Produces a smaller tree that requires careful pruning and training. Blooms late. Leafs out late.

plants.name: Black Walnut Seedling
plants.description: Not a true cultivar. Seedlings of Northern California Black Walnut trees.

plants.name: Thomas
plants.description: Eastern Black Walnut cultivar that may be worthy of consideration.

plants.name: Ohio
plants.description: Eastern Black Walnut cultivar that may be worthy of consideration.

plants.name: Meyers
plants.description: Eastern Black Walnut cultivar that may be worthy of consideration.

plants.name: Chico
plants.description: Male vine used to pollinate Hayward, 8:1 ratio.

plants.name: Hayward
plants.description: The commercial female cultivar grown in California. Large fruit. Excellent flavor. Will ripen on the vine but can be picked when still hard, placed in cold storage (32Â°F), and removed to room temperature for final ripening. Will keep for up to 6 months.

plants.name: Matua
plants.description: Male vine used to pollinate Hayward, 8:1 ratio.

plants.name: Tamori
plants.description: Male vine used to pollinate Hayward, 8:1 ratio.

plants.name: Anna
plants.description: Nickel-sized fruit. Unique flavor. Very productive.

plants.name: Issai
plants.description: Dime-sized fruit that requires no cross-pollination.

plants.name: Ken's Red
plants.description: Dime-sized fruit. Red flesh and skin. Excellent flavor.

plants.category_description: These kiwi cultivars are adapted to the low latitudes of southern California because they have low winter chilling requirements (50â€“250 hours).

plants.name: Adriatic
plants.description: Good fresh but especially good for drying. Yellow skin and amber flesh.

plants.name: Black Mission
plants.description: The most dependable cultivar for the home orchard. Purple-black skin with red flesh.

plants.name: Brown Turkey
plants.description: Large fruit. Excellent quality. Purple-green skin. Red flesh.

plants.name: Italian Everbearing
plants.description: Brown. Turkey type. Very prolific.

plants.name: Kadota
plants.description: Requires high temperatures and a long growing season to perform well. Yellow-green fruit with amber flesh. Produces both a breba and a second crop with moderate pruning.

plants.name: Osborn
plants.description: Performs well only in cool coastal areas. Purple-bronze fruit with amber flesh. Very prolific.

plants.name: Smyrna-type
plants.description: Requires cross-pollination by the Capri fig female wasp to produce a crop. Capri figs containing female wasps may be difficult to locate for backyard tree fruit producers.

plants.name: White Genoa
plants.description: Good for coastal locations. Large fruit. Yellow-green, thin skin. Strawberry flesh. Ripens when others won't.

plants.name: Ascolano
plants.description: Large-fruited cultivar, the most cold-hardy of all table cultivars in California. Large fruit, Oil is very aromatic.

plants.name: Manzanillo
plants.description: The main cultivar used for the black California-style olive. Low, spreading, medium-sized tree, early-maturing fruit with a medium oil content. Trees are susceptible to cold injury, peacock spot, and olive knot.

plants.name: Mission
plants.description: Medium-sized fruit, high oil content, cold-hardy, susceptible to foliar diseases.

plants.name: Sevillano
plants.description: Largest fruit. Very susceptible to olive fly. Produces an interesting, herbal-flavored oil.

plants.name: Arbequina
plants.description: A cultivar from northern Spain that produces a very high quality fruity oil. Fruit is small. Very fruitful. One of the most cold tolerant.

plants.name: Coratina
plants.description: A cultivar from southern Italy that ripens very late. Very high oil content and very high in poly-phenols. Regular bearing but sensitive to cold.

plants.name: Frantoio
plants.description: Italian cultivar with a high oil content that is very aromatic, floral, and grassy. Not adapted to hot desert areas. Cold-sensitive.

plants.name: Leccino
plants.description: Italian cultivar used in olive oil blends with Frantoio. Ripens a little earlier than other cultivars. Cold-hardy.

plants.name: Maurino
plants.description: Italian cultivar used in olive oil blends. Very flavorful, spicy oil.

plants.name: Pendolino
plants.description: Italian cultivar used in olive oil blends. Also used as a pollenizer. Cold-hardy.

plants.name: Picual
plants.description: Spanish cultivar used for oil and table fruit. Very high in polyphenols and oil. Very fruity. Ripens early, easy to harvest. Cold-hardy.

plants.name: Baru
plants.description: Round; orange skin. Sweet brown flesh.

plants.name: Diospyros virginiana
plants.description: Native species, not a cultivar. Very small, very flavorful fruit. Must be eaten when soft.

plants.name: Fuyu
plants.description: Large, flat; orange-red color. Flesh is firm like an apple and nonastringent when ripe. Cross-pollination is no required, but when present, fruit will have seed. Trees are smaller, requiring 14-16ft. Fruit loses astringency at maturity while still firm and crunchy.

plants.name: Hachiya
plants.description: Large, deep orange-red, acorn-shaped fruit. Flesh turns brown around the seed and must be very soft to eat. Does not need cross-pollination. Trees get large and require 20 ft. Fruit is astringent until very ripe and soft.

plants.name: Hyakume
plants.description: Cinnamon-chocolate-colored flesh.
